metadata.title: CVE-2020-35111 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: When an extension with the proxy permission registered to receive <all_urls>, the proxy.onRequest callback was not triggered for view-source URLs. While web content cannot navigate to such URLs, a user opening View Source could have inadvertently leaked their IP address. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 84, Thunderbird < 78.6, and Firefox ESR < 78.6.

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '84.0+build3-0ubuntu2').
mozjs78 package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
